required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating Off-label Use of Direct Oral Anticoagulants (DOACs) in Hypercoagulable States
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating Off-label Use of Direct Oral Anticoagulants (DOACs) in Hypercoagulable States

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective, cohort study chart review in patients with hypercoagulable states.

detailed_description.textblock:
- Retrospective, cohort study chart review in patients at Methodist Health System
- Data will be pulled on all patients with hypercoagulable states identified by ICD-9/ICD-10 codes from January 1st, 2015 to December 31st, 2019

primary_outcome.measure: Rates of thrombotic events during the study period
primary_outcome.description: Rates of thrombotic events during the study period

primary_outcome.measure: Rates of hemorrhagic events during the study period
primary_outcome.description: Rates of hemorrhagic events during the study period

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of DOAC prescribing for thrombosis prevention in hypercoagulable states
secondary_outcome.description: Rates of DOAC prescribing for thrombosis prevention in hypercoagulable states

arm_group.description: All patients with hypercoagulable states identified by ICD-9/ICD-10 codes from January 1st, 2015 to December 31st, 2019

study_pop.textblock: Patients with hypercoagulable states identified by ICD-9/ICD-10 codes from January 1st, 2015 to December 31st, 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients â‰¥ 18 year-old
- Patients with diagnosis of hypercoagulable state identified by ICD-9/ICD-10 codes
- Patients who were prescribed DOACs or VKA for primary or secondary prevention of thrombosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with FDA-approved indications of oral anticoagulants including atrial fibrillation or treatment/prevention of thrombotic events unrelated to specified hypercoagulable states
- Patients with incomplete electronic medical records
